label: 下司
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: (alt. gesu) a local estate manager, frequently an office (shiki 職) occupied by a land opener who had commended fields to a noble estate proprietor (ryôke). In return, the commender received appointment as geshi of the land from that proprietor. [領家]
